document.docAuthor: Liu, Zhen, He, Jun-Hua, Chen, Xue-Xin & Gupta, Ankita
document.masterDocTitle: The ater-group of the genus Apanteles Foerster (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Microgastrinae) from China with the descriptions of forty-eight new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The ater-group of the genus Apanteles Foerster (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Microgastrinae) from China with the descriptions of forty-eight new species

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Apanteles verticalis
Song & Chen, 2004: 93
. Holotype ♀ — Hubei , China [FAFU].

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Body length 2.4 mm , fore wing length 3.1 mm . Body mostly black, hind femur yellow. Ocelli large, posterior tangent to anterior ocellus transecting posterior ocelli, distance between fore and hind ocellus shorter than diameter of hind ocellus. Antenna distinctly shorter than body length, penultimate flagellomere 1.4× longer than wide. Interspaces between punctures on disc of mesonotum not smaller than its diameter. Areola on propodeum closed, V-shaped apically, with strong costulae. Pterostigma 2.8× as long as its widest part, vein 1-R1 1.3× longer than pterostigma, vein r 1.9× longer than vein 2-SR, strongly angled at junction. T1 nearly parallel-sided, 2.3× longer than hind width, turned-over part slightly shiny, strongly rugose, longitudinal channel absent; T2 shiny and polished, trapezoidal, 2.5× wider than long in the middle; T3 1.6× longer than T2. Ovipositor sheath as long as hind tibia.

Remarks. Characters of the examined specimens mostly agree with the published descriptions except for wider T2 sometimes.
